required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Different Lung Ultrasound Imaging Protocols in COVID-19 Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Different Lung Ultrasound Imaging Protocols in COVID -19 Pneumonia

lead_sponsor.agency: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Lung ultrasonography (LUS) is also used in COVID 19 pneumonia for diagnostic and follow-up purposes.It has been demonstrated in different studies that it can be used for pathologies in pleural and lung tissue. LUS was applied by different researchers by dividing the lungs into 12 and 14 regions and the results were shared.

detailed_description.textblock: In our study, we aimed to determine the correlation between lung findings of COVID 19 pneumonia and thoracic tomography with the results of LUS applied to different numbers (12 versus 14) of areas.

study_design_info.masking_description: The investigator was unaware of patient information such as medical history, PCR (polymerase chain reaction) test result, laboratory measurements, and CT scan results

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Thoracic CT imaging results and LUS results
primary_outcome.description: Lung ultrasonography will be performed within 6 hours of the Thoracic CT.

secondary_outcome.description: Identifying the characteristics of the abnormal findings detected in Thoracic CT and LUS

intervention.description: Application of 12 areas (2 posterior, 2 lateral, and 2 anterior)lung ultrasonography protocol using the convex ultrasound probe (2-6 MHz)
Application of 14 areas (3 posterior, 2 lateral, and 2 anterior) lung ultrasonography protocol using the convex ultrasound probe (2-6 MHz)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 and 85 years old
- Hospitalized in intensive care unit
- PCR (polymerase chain reaction) tested
- Thoracic CT applied
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous lung operation
- Thoracic wall disorder
- Interstitial lung disease
- Patients who did not consent to participate in the study

facility.name: University of Health Sciences, Bursa Yuksek Ihtisas Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bursa Yüksek İhtisas Education and Research Hospital
